snippet: The opposition leader Daw Aung San Suu Kyi called on the government to deploy more troops to restore peace and stability in Rakhine state, hit by recent deadly violence between Buddhists and Muslims.
abstract: Myanmar opposition leader Daw Aung San Suu Kyi calls on government to deploy more troops to stop violence and restore peace between Buddhist and Muslims.
lead_paragraph: The opposition leader Daw Aung San Suu Kyi called on the government to deploy more troops to restore peace and stability in Rakhine state, hit by recent deadly violence between Buddhists and Muslims.

headline.seo: Myanmar: Aung San Suu Kyi Calls for More Troops in Rakhine state
headline.main: Myanmar: Aung San Suu Kyi Calls for More Troops to Keep Peace
headline.print_headline: Myanmar: Aung San Suu Kyi Calls for More Troops to Keep Peace
